summary: This is an email from December 6, 2021, summarizing a Microsoft Teams meeting regarding witness preparation for AT&T records from 2004. The meeting involved discussing the appearance, consistency, and authenticity of the records, noting AT&T's internal billing report system.

persons.name: Phil Fanara
persons.role: Meeting participant, familiar with AT&T records
persons.context: Participated in a Teams meeting about witness preparation regarding AT&T records from 2004; noted the records' consistency and that they appear unaltered.

persons.name: Tamika Williamson
persons.role: Meeting participant (possibly legal or investigative staff)
persons.context: Participated in a Teams meeting regarding witness preparation and AT&T records; the email is addressed to her.

connections.description: Both participated in a Microsoft Teams meeting on December 6, 2021, regarding witness preparation and AT&T records.

events.title: Teams Meeting on AT&T Records
events.description: A Microsoft Teams meeting was held for witness preparation regarding AT&T records from 2004, discussing their appearance, consistency, and authenticity.

keyFacts: A meeting occurred on December 6, 2021, to prepare witnesses regarding AT&T records from 2004.
Phil Fanara indicated the AT&T records from 2004 appear consistent and unaltered.
AT&T uses an internal billing report system for such data, not the actual customer bills.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
